p: The oral manifestations in ZIKV are not a frequent occurrence; although, Foy et al. have reported oral aphthous ulcers on the lip mucosa.[ 38] Aphthous ulcers were also a frequent oral feature during the 2013 French Polynesian epidemic. However, the data supporting other oral features in ZIKV infection is scarce.[ 62 63] Hyperemia and petechial lesions on the hard palate of ZIKV-infected patient were documented by Brasil et al.[ 64]
